meanings.definition: Resembling basalt in color or texture.
meanings.sent1: The basaltine walls of the cave were dark and rough.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a basaltine color palette for the volcanic landscape painting.
meanings.sent3: The basaltine curtains in the room made it feel like a mysterious cave.
meanings.sent4: Her hair, basaltine in its dark hue, flowed like a river of shadows.
meanings.sent5: The basaltine sky at dusk painted the horizon in shades of black and gray.

meanings.sent1: The sturdy basaltine bridge spanned the river with ease.
meanings.sent2: The ancient temple was constructed with basaltine blocks.
meanings.sent3: The basaltine statue seemed to come alive in the moonlight.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed off the basaltine walls of the cavern.
meanings.sent5: The basaltine columns of the building stood tall against the sky.

meanings.definition: A type of rock formed from solidified lava.
meanings.sent1: The hikers marveled at the basaltine formations along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The geologist studied the basaltine samples under a microscope.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the basaltine rocks were dragon eggs.
meanings.sent4: The basaltine cliffs rose majestically from the sea below.
meanings.sent5: The basaltine boulders littered the volcanic landscape.
